conclusion: Initial analysis of how shadows A, B, C, and D change when the light source moves.
The light source is initially positioned to the left of the objects, casting shadows to the right.
The light source moves to the right, directly above the objects.
When the light source is directly above the objects, the shadows will be cast directly below the objects.
Shadows will become shorter as the light source moves directly above the objects because the angle of incidence becomes more vertical.
Shadow A moves directly below the egg.
Shadow B moves directly below the blue object.
Shadow C moves directly below the blue object.
Shadow D moves directly below the blue object.
All shadows (A, B, C, D) will become shorter as the light source moves directly above the objects.
The shadows A, B, C, and D will move directly below their respective objects and become shorter as the light source moves to the right and directly above the objects.
